result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon R Steltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon R Steltz

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ. (03CF446 Br. 3 and 04CF462 Dodge Co.)  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.  Argument by counsel and statements by the defendant.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information w/i 48 hours.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for pretrial and anticipate resolution at next appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on March 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel's first appearance and request adjournment for discovery and pretrial.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not SPD eligible.  State does not opose a signature bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
